intro: Excoecaria bodenbenderi, commonly known as the Madagascar glorybower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are woody and can be branched. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in inflorescences that are surrounded by showy, petal-like structures.
